Author: tolken#2655
Content: @PTYX easier said than done, but when asked what sets AtomicDex apart, doesnâ€™t seem like there was a clear answer other than Komodo has been doing it for a long time. Key points id reiterate - no KYC required, supports Eth, erc-20, most bitcoin protocol coins etc. Kadan knows this of course and Iâ€™ve heard him articulate this clearly before, but sometimes hard to think on your toes I guess ðŸ˜ƒ need to nail down those talking points, thatâ€™s a softball waiting to be hit out of the park.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: @tolken  what sets it apart currently :  Worlds only mobile cross chain atomic swap Dex .  Liquidity Multiplier to get more out of trading.   Future:  multi-ecosystem pegged coins ,  Selective trading filters,  private trading layer ( via pirate )

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: The multi ecosystem pegged coins and private trading layer will be hard for competitors to replicate

Author: tolken#2655
Content: True more great points. Letâ€™s make up some flash cards for his next interview ðŸ˜› mm2 and AtomicDex, when people see how well it works, i think it has a serious chance of making a dent where others have failed.  I am concerned about the dex-cex liquidity solutions. Theyâ€™re definitely something we need to take advantage of, but ultimately regulators will make it illegal. That said, it may just be a bit of a race. Once thereâ€™s sufficient dex liquidity, the cex interface /liquidity wonâ€™t be as necessary if at all.
